alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 10:31AM EDT until April 10 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. At 7.7 feet, Change Bridge Road in Montville, north of Woodmont Road and south of Stiles Lane, floods. River Road in Montville floods near Condurso`s Garden Center. Both roads are closed. At 8.0 feet, Due to high water on the Rockaway River, water backs up through storm drains and flood portions of Lancaster Avenue, Normandy Drive, Buckingham Circle, Sheffield Place, Manchester Drive and Konner Avenue in Montville. High water on the Rockaway also backs up Hatfield Creek in Montville and causes additional flooding on Lancaster Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 6.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EDT Friday was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.0 feet on 09/02/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 6.4 Fri 10 a 6.1 5.1 7.0 2pm 4/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EDT.
